metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17670 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In VideoLAN VLC media player through 2.2.8, there is a type conversion vulnerability in modules/demux/mp4/libmp4.c in the MP4 demux module leading to a invalid free, because the type of a box may be changed between a read operation and a free operation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17670` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
libvlc5 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
libvlccore9 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-bin - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-data - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-l10n - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1

No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> According to the openwall thread, "the VLC project probably won't backport a fix to 2.2.x." I'm deferring this CVE.

criterions.comment: vlc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1').
